result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Zugastia, Armando, Jr
defendant.address: 1512 Big Bend Rd. Apt. 202, Waukesha, WI 53186

records.addlTxt: Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $500.00

9:30 AM Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Armando Zugastia Jr. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defendant called Atty Hughes and the Court prior to court that his car had broken down and he didn't have a ride.
Atty Hughes advises the court that the State has an offer to amend if he get his concealed carry permit.
Court issues a capias and revokes and forfeits bond due to this being the 2nd non-appearance with car problems.

10:33 AM Defendant Armando Zugastia in court with attorney Steven Hughes.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Hughes states he has received an offer which contemplates the the Defendant to complete the CCW class to have the charge amended and requests an adjournment.
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

10:49 AM Defendant Armando Zugastia in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.

11:17 AM Defendant Armando Zugastia not in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that the defendant called the Clerk's office stating he got a flat tire while driving here.
The State requests a warrant issue but STAYED.
Court ordered a $500.00 warrant stayed until next court date.
EXT CODE 3.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
